text.0: ðæt hē Ēotena bearn inne gemunde. The adv. inne, 'inside,' 'within' (cp. breðer inne 'wēoll 2113), in combination with gemunde signifies 'in the bottom of his heart' gemunan, by concretion, means 'show one's remembrance by deeds.' Kock L 6.13.1.35 would connect inne with ðæt (= ðe), ' in which.'
